availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Rumsey Weir, Sr. (Muhlenberg County, attorney, merchant, politician, and soldier)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, attorney, merchant, politician, and soldier. Greenville, Kentucky, native. Son of James Weir and Anna Cowman Rumsey Weir. Married to Harriet R. Miller Weir on September 2, 1838. Father of James Weir, Jr., Anna C. Weir, Virginia Weir, Miller Weir, Max Weir, Jane Weir, Sallie Ann Weir, Susan M. Weir, and Emily Weir. Served in the State Legislature representing Muhlenberg County in 1841 and 1842. Lawyer in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Owned forty enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Lawyer and merchant in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the Muhlenberg County Home Guard in 1861. Served in the State Legislature representing Muhlenberg County from 1862 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Subdivision 2, p. 272A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Subdivision 2, p. 10-11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky State, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 41.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 3-4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, South Carrollton, p. 6.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000557316, p. 4.
Otto A. Rothert, A History of Muhlenberg County (Louisville, KY: John P. Morton & Company, 1913), 56-62.
Find A Grave, "Edward Rumsey Weir, Sr. (1816-1891)," Memorial #71435457, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71435457# (accessed December 4, 2018).
